intro: Eurybia propinqua, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to sandy or rocky soils. Eurybia propinqua is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dunes.
